author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Delhi Police have been particularly looking for Umar Khalid. All five students were seen on Sunday night participating in cultural activities organised as a part of the ongoing protests demanding Kanhaiya Kumar’s release. There is no clarity on where these students were all these days.

Shehla Rashid, JNU students’ union vice-president, told The Hindu that the five students are innocent. “They will be here only. If the police want, they can come and arrest them,” she said.

The police had given the names of the five students to the court on the same day they arrested Mr Kumar.

According to the police, these students were involved in shouting anti-national slogans on February 9 when an event to mark the death anniversary of Afzal Guru was organised on the campus. A case under charges of sedition and criminal conspiracy was lodged against unknown persons on February 11. A day later, Mr Kumar was arrested from the campus.

JNU had also constituted an internal committee to investigate the February 9 incident. The five students who have been named in the FIR also figure in the JNU’s internal committee report. The students have been debarred from all academic activities by the university administration.
title: Students seen taking part in cultural activities
